translated: He is one who has attained the state of peace.🔽He is one who has a retinue that has attained the state of peace.

original: dgra bcom pa 'khor dgra bcom pa /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa 'khor dgra bcom pa /
translated: He is an arhat with a retinue of arhats.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'khor 'dod chags dang bral ba /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba 'khor 'dod chags dang bral ba /
translated: He is one who is free from desire with a retinue that is free from desire.

original: mdzes pa 'khor mdzes pa /
analyzed: mdzes pa 'khor mdzes pa /
translated: He is one who is beautiful with a retinue that is beautiful.

original: khyu mchog ba lang gi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /🔽glang po che glang po'i phru gu'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: khyu mchog ba lang gi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu / glang po che glang po'i phru gu'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a bull surrounded by a herd of cattle.🔽He is like an elephant surrounded by a herd of elephant cubs.

original: seng ge mche ba can gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /🔽ngang pa'i rgyal po ngang pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: seng ge mche ba can gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu / ngang pa'i rgyal po ngang pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a lion surrounded by a pack of carnivores.🔽He is like the king of geese surrounded by a flock of geese.

original: nam mkha' lding bya'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: nam mkha' lding bya'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a garuḍa surrounded by a flock of birds.

original: bram ze slob ma'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: bram ze slob ma'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a brahman surrounded by a group of students.

original: sman pa mkhas pa nad pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: sman pa mkhas pa nad pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a skilled physician surrounded by a group of patients.

original: dpa' bo ru pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: dpa' bo ru pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a hero surrounded by a group of soldiers.

original: lam mkhan 'gron po'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: lam mkhan 'gron po'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: He is like a guide surrounded by a group of travelers.

original: ded dpon tshong pa'i tshogs kyis bsko ra ba lta @145b bu; khams kyi rgyal po blon po'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: ded dpon tshong pa'i tshogs kyis bsko ra ba lta @145b bu; khams kyi rgyal po blon po'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like a caravan leader surrounded by a group of merchants,🔽like a king of the realm surrounded by a group of ministers,

original: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po bu stong gis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: 'khor los bsgyur ba'i rgyal po bu stong gis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like a universal monarch surrounded by a thousand sons,

original: zla ba rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: zla ba rgyu skar gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like the moon surrounded by a multitude of stars,

original: nyi ma 'od zer stong gis bskor ba lta bu /🔽yul 'khor skyong dri za'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: nyi ma 'od zer stong gis bskor ba lta bu / yul 'khor skyong dri za'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like the sun surrounded by a thousand light rays,🔽like Dhṛtarāṣṭra surrounded by a multitude of gandharvas,

original: 'phags skyes po grul bum gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /🔽mig mi bzang klu'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu; rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: 'phags skyes po grul bum gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu / mig mi bzang klu'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu; rnam thos kyi bu gnod sbyin gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like Virūḍhaka surrounded by a multitude of kumbhāṇḍas,🔽like Virūpākṣa surrounded by a multitude of nāgas,🔽like Vaiśravaṇa surrounded by a multitude of yakṣas,

original: thags bzang ris lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /🔽brgya byin sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: thags bzang ris lha ma yin gyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu / brgya byin sum cu rtsa gsum pa'i tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like Vemacitrin surrounded by a multitude of asuras,🔽like Śakra surrounded by a multitude of the Thirty-Three,

original: tshangs pa tshangs ris kyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
analyzed: tshangs pa tshangs ris kyi tshogs kyis bskor ba lta bu /
translated: like Brahmā surrounded by a multitude of the Brahmakāyika gods,

original: rgya mtsho g-yo ba med pa lta bu /
analyzed: rgya mtsho g-yo ba med pa lta bu /
translated: He was like an unmoving ocean,

original: sprin chu dang bcas pa lta bu /
analyzed: sprin chu dang bcas pa lta bu /
translated: like a cloud with water,

original: glang po dam pa dregs pa dang bral ba ltar dbang po rnams shin tu dul bas spyod lam gyi tshul ma 'khrugs pa sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis kun nas brgyan pa /
analyzed: glang po dam pa dregs pa dang bral ba ltar dbang po rnams shin tu dul bas spyod lam gyi tshul ma 'khrugs pa sku skyes bu chen po'i mtshan sum cu rtsa gnyis kyis kun nas brgyan pa /
translated: and like an excellent elephant free from arrogance. His faculties were very disciplined, and his conduct was not disturbed. His body was adorned with the thirty-two marks of a great being.

original: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par mdzes par byas pa /
analyzed: dpe byad bzang po brgyad cus rnam par mdzes par byas pa /
translated: He was beautified with the eighty minor marks.

original: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa'i sku nyi ma'i 'od zer stong pas lhag pa'i 'od can /
analyzed: 'od 'dom gang gis brgyan pa'i sku nyi ma'i 'od zer stong pas lhag pa'i 'od can /
translated: His body was adorned with a fathom of light, and his radiance was greater than a thousand sun rays.

original: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun nas mdzes pa /
analyzed: rin po che'i ri bo 'gro ba ltar kun nas mdzes pa /
translated: He was beautiful like a moving mountain of jewels.

original: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
analyzed: stobs bcu dang / mi 'jigs pa bzhi dang / ma 'dres pa dran pa nye bar gzhag pa gsum dang / thugs rje chen po dang ldan pa /
translated: He had the ten powers, the four fearlessnesses, the three establishments of mindfulness, and great compassion.

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu @146a *//
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun chen po dang thabs gcig tu @146a *//
translated: He was together with a great saṅgha of monks

original: 'bab chu ro hi ta kar byon to //
analyzed: 'bab chu ro hi ta kar byon to //
translated: and had arrived at the Rohiṇī River.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa 'bab chu ro hi ta kar byon to zhes thos so //
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa 'bab chu ro hi ta kar byon to zhes thos so //
translated: King Śuddhodana heard that the young Siddhārtha had gone to the Rohitaka River.

original: thos nas kyang rgyal po zas gtsang gis grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi rdo ba dang / gyo mo dang / gseg ma rnams bsal nas tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab /
analyzed: thos nas kyang rgyal po zas gtsang gis grong khyer ser skya'i gzhi rdo ba dang / gyo mo dang / gseg ma rnams bsal nas tsandan gyi chus chag chag btab /
translated: Having heard this, King Śuddhodana had the city of Kapilavastu cleared of stones, pebbles, and gravel, and then sprinkled with sandalwood water.

original: dri shin tu zhim po'i pog por nye bar bshams /
analyzed: dri shin tu zhim po'i pog por nye bar bshams /
translated: He had fragrant censers set up

original: dar gyi chun 'chang mang po dbyangs te /
analyzed: dar gyi chun 'chang mang po dbyangs te /
translated: and hung many silk tassels.

original: gang yang 'bab chu ro hi ta ka nas gang yang n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba de'i bar gyi lam shin tu mdzes par byas te /
analyzed: gang yang 'bab chu ro hi ta ka nas gang yang n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba de'i bar gyi lam shin tu mdzes par byas te /
translated: He had the road from the Rohitaka River to the Nyagrodha Park made very beautiful.

original: sa phyogs yangs shing rgya che bar gdan rnam par bkra ba dag gshom du bcug go /
analyzed: sa phyogs yangs shing rgya che bar gdan rnam par bkra ba dag gshom du bcug go /
translated: He had colorful seats arranged in a spacious and vast area.

original: de nas 'bab chu ro hi ta ka la dge slong kha cig ni lag pa 'khru bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas 'bab chu ro hi ta ka la dge slong kha cig ni lag pa 'khru bar byed do //
translated: Then, at the Rohitaka River, some monks washed their hands,

original: kha ci gi ni so shing 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: kha ci gi ni so shing 'dor bar byed do //
translated: some threw out their tooth sticks,

original: kha cig ni khrus byed do //
analyzed: kha cig ni khrus byed do //
translated: and some bathed.

original: ser skya'i gzhi na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams kyis gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa gshegs so zhes thos so //
analyzed: ser skya'i gzhi na gnas pa'i sh'akya rnams kyis gzhon nu don thams cad grub pa gshegs so zhes thos so //
translated: The Śākyas living in Kapilavastu heard that the young Siddhārtha had come.

original: thos nas kyang kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul /
analyzed: thos nas kyang kha cig ni sngon gyi dge ba'i rtsa bas bskul /
translated: Some were urged by their previous roots of virtue,

original: kha cig ni ya mtshan skyes nas thams cad n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba nas byung ste /🔽ci yab sras kyi zhabs la phyag byed dam /
analyzed: kha cig ni ya mtshan skyes nas thams cad n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba nas byung ste / ci yab sras kyi zhabs la phyag byed dam /
translated: some were filled with wonder, and all of them came out of the Nyagrodha Park.🔽They thought, Should the father bow down at the feet of the son,

original: 'on te sras yab kyi zhabs la phyag byed pa lta'o snyam mo //
analyzed: 'on te sras yab kyi zhabs la phyag byed pa lta'o snyam mo //
translated: or should the son bow down at the feet of the father?

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das 'di snyam du dgongs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One thought this:

original: gal te nga zhabs kyis @146b ser skya'i gzhir gshegs na sh'akya'i nga rgyal can rnams kye ma'o gzhon nu don thams cad grub pas dka' thub kyi nags su gshegs nas ltog po zhig grub pa lta zhig ste /
analyzed: gal te nga zhabs kyis @146b ser skya'i gzhir gshegs na sh'akya'i nga rgyal can rnams kye ma'o gzhon nu don thams cad grub pas dka' thub kyi nags su gshegs nas ltog po zhig grub pa lta zhig ste /
translated: If I go to Kapilavastu on foot, the proud Śākyas will think, Oh, the young Siddhārtha went to the forest of ascetics and became emaciated, and now he has attained some meager accomplishment.

original: des lha brgya stong phrag dums zhabs 'bring byas nas steng gi nam mkha' las gshegs te des de srid du dka' ba brgya stong spyad pas bdud rtsi thob nas nga zhabs kyis gshegs pa lta zhes ma dad pa skyes par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
analyzed: des lha brgya stong phrag dums zhabs 'bring byas nas steng gi nam mkha' las gshegs te des de srid du dka' ba brgya stong spyad pas bdud rtsi thob nas nga zhabs kyis gshegs pa lta zhes ma dad pa skyes par 'gyur ro snyam nas /
translated: He will think, ‘I have practiced a hundred thousand austerities to attain nectar, and now I will go on foot.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs mnyam par bzhag na /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis thugs mnyam par bzhag na /
translated: Then the Blessed One, having entered into equipoise,

original: shar phyogs kyi steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi mdzad de /
analyzed: shar phyogs kyi steng gi bar snang la mngon par 'phags nas spyod lam rnam pa bzhi mdzad de /
translated: rose up into the sky above the eastern direction and engaged in the four types of conduct.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: 'chag pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal bar mdzad do //
analyzed: 'chag pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal bar mdzad do //
translated: he walked, stood, sat, and lay down.

original: me'i ting nge 'dzin la'ang snyoms par 'jug par mdzad de /
analyzed: me'i ting nge 'dzin la'ang snyoms par 'jug par mdzad de /
translated: He also entered the meditative absorption of fire,

original: me'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs dag 'byin par mdzad de /
analyzed: me'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs pa na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyi sku las 'od zer rnam pa sna tshogs dag 'byin par mdzad de /
translated: and when he entered the meditative absorption of fire, various kinds of light rays issued forth from the body of the Blessed Buddha.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Namely,

original: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog dag go /
analyzed: sngon po dang / ser po dang / dmar po dang / dkar po dang / leb rgan dang / shel gyi kha dog dag go /
translated: yellow, red, white, violet, and crystal-colored.

original: cho 'phrul zung du'ang ston par mdzad de /
analyzed: cho 'phrul zung du'ang ston par mdzad de /
translated: He also displayed a double miracle:

original: sku'i smad nas me 'bar bar mdzad la /
analyzed: sku'i smad nas me 'bar bar mdzad la /
translated: from the lower part of his body he emitted flames,🔽and from the upper part of his body he emitted cold water.

original: sku'i stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par mdzad de sku'i stod nas me 'bar bar mdzad la sku'i smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs pa mdzad pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
analyzed: sku'i stod nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs par mdzad de sku'i stod nas me 'bar bar mdzad la sku'i smad nas chu grang mo'i rgyun 'bebs pa mdzad pa de lta bu'i ting nge 'dzin la snyoms par zhugs so //
translated: From the upper part of his body he emitted flames, and from the lower part of his body he emitted cold water.

original: @147a *// shar phyogs la ji lta bar lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: @147a *// shar phyogs la ji lta bar lho dang / nub dang / byang phyogs su'ang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as in the east, so also in the south, west, and north.

original: phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bstan nas /
analyzed: phyogs bzhir rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul rnam pa bzhi bstan nas /
translated: Having displayed the four kinds of miraculous power in the four directions,

original: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par 'du mdzad pa de bsdus te ta la bdun gyi srid tsam na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul gyi mngon par 'du mdzad pa de bsdus te ta la bdun gyi srid tsam na bzhugs so //
translated: he withdrew that miraculous manifestation and sat at a height of seven tāla trees.

original: dge slong rnams ni ta la drug gi srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: dge slong rnams ni ta la drug gi srid tsam na'o //
translated: The monks sat at a height of six tāla trees.

original: bcom ldan 'das drug gi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams lnga'i srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das drug gi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams lnga'i srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was six cubits tall, the monks were five cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das lnga'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams bzhi'i srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lnga'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams bzhi'i srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was five cubits tall, the monks were four cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhi'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gsum gyi srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhi'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gsum gyi srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was four cubits tall, the monks were three cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das gsum gyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gnyis kyi srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsum gyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gnyis kyi srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was three cubits tall, the monks were two cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das gnyis kyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams ta la gcig gi srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gnyis kyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams ta la gcig gi srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was two cubits tall, the monks were one palm tree cubit tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das mi bdun gyi srid tsam na bzhugs na ni dge slong rnams mi drug gi srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das mi bdun gyi srid tsam na bzhugs na ni dge slong rnams mi drug gi srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was seven human cubits tall, the monks were six human cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das drug gi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams lnga'i srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das drug gi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams lnga'i srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was six human cubits tall, the monks were five human cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das lnga'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams bzhi'i srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lnga'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams bzhi'i srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was five human cubits tall, the monks were four human cubits tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das bzhi'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gsum gyi srid tsam na'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bzhi'i srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gsum gyi srid tsam na'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was four cubits tall, the monks were three cubits tall.🔽When the Blessed One was three cubits tall, the monks were two cubits tall.🔽When the Blessed One was two cubits tall, the monks were one cubit tall.

original: bcom ldan 'das gsum gyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gnyis kyi srid tsam na'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das gnyis kyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams mi gang @147b lhag tsam na'o //🔽bcom ldan 'das mi gang lhag tsam na ni dge slong rnams sa la'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gsum gyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams gnyis kyi srid tsam na'o // bcom ldan 'das gnyis kyi srid tsam na ni dge slong rnams mi gang @147b lhag tsam na'o // bcom ldan 'das mi gang lhag tsam na ni dge slong rnams sa la'o //
translated: When the Blessed One was one cubit tall, the monks were just a little taller than the ground.

original: rgyal po zas gtsang gis cho 'phrul de lta bu de dang / dge slong mang po mthong nas de la bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa ma shes te mongs par gyur to //
analyzed: rgyal po zas gtsang gis cho 'phrul de lta bu de dang / dge slong mang po mthong nas de la bcom ldan 'das gang yin pa ma shes te mongs par gyur to //
translated: King Śuddhodana, seeing such miracles and many monks, did not know which one was the Blessed One and became confused.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la smras pa /
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa 'char ka la smras pa /
translated: Then he said to Venerable Udayana,

original: 'char ka / 'di na ngur smrig gyon pa'i rab tu byung ba mang po zhig yod na de la gzhon nu gang yin /
analyzed: 'char ka / 'di na ngur smrig gyon pa'i rab tu byung ba mang po zhig yod na de la gzhon nu gang yin /
translated: Udayana, there are many renunciants here wearing saffron robes. Which one is the prince?

original: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bcom ldan 'das bstan nas smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa 'char kas bcom ldan 'das bstan nas smras pa /
translated: Venerable Udayana pointed out the Blessed One and said,🔽That one over there, with the body of a great man, with the thirty-two marks of a great man, with the radiance of a thousand suns, with a halo extending an arm's length, with the light of the major and minor marks, with the body of a great sage, with the body of a great nāga, with the body of a great bull, with the body of a great lion, with the body of a great elephant, with the body of a great hero, with the body of a great sage, with the body of a great brahman, with the body of a great śakra, with the body of a great vaiśravaṇa, with the body of a great maheśvara, with the body of a great sun, with the body of a great moon, with the body of a great fire, with the body of a great cloud, with the body of a great king, with the body of a great cakravartin, with the body of a great universal monarch, with the body of a great sage, with the body of a great brahman, with the body of a great śakra, with the body of a great vaiśravaṇa, with the body of a great maheśvara, with the body of a great sun, with the body of a great moon, with the body of a great fire, with the body of a great cloud, with the body of a great king, with the body of a great cakravartin, with the body of a great universal monarch, with the body of a great sage, with the body of a great brahman, with the body of a great śakra, with the body of a great vaiśravaṇa, with the body

original: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das lags so //
analyzed: 'di ni bcom ldan 'das lags so //
translated: He is the Blessed One.

original: srid pa'i mthar byed sems kyi dbang phyug 'dren pa lags //
analyzed: srid pa'i mthar byed sems kyi dbang phyug 'dren pa lags //
translated: He is the one who puts an end to existence, the lord of the mind, the leader.

original: 'di ni nyon mongs sel mdzad nyin byed don ni kun tu ston mdzad lags //
analyzed: 'di ni nyon mongs sel mdzad nyin byed don ni kun tu ston mdzad lags //
translated: He is the one who removes afflictions, the sun, the one who shows all meanings.

original: 'di ni dgongs pa bzhin brnyes stobs bcu mnga' bas kun gyi pha rol gshegs pa lags //
analyzed: 'di ni dgongs pa bzhin brnyes stobs bcu mnga' bas kun gyi pha rol gshegs pa lags //
translated: He is the one who has attained the intended, the one who has gone to the other shore through the ten powers.

original: dri med btsal ba chos kyi dbang phyug khyod kyi sras lags mi dbang de gzigs shig /
analyzed: dri med btsal ba chos kyi dbang phyug khyod kyi sras lags mi dbang de gzigs shig /

translated: “Well now, I will enter into such a samādhi that I will see from what the Śākyas arose, what their beginning was, what their cause was, and what their lineage was in the past.”

translated: He saw that they were born from the womb of a Śākya woman and the seed of a Śākya man.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar mthu che ba gzhan yang mchis lags sam; rgyal po chen po /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi nyan thos 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che ba 'di ltar mthu che ba gzhan yang mchis lags sam; rgyal po chen po /
translated: “Venerable Mahā­maudgalyāyana, are there any other disciples of the Blessed One who are as powerful and mighty as you?”

original: mchis so zhes tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: mchis so zhes tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: “Great King, there are,” he replied, and he spoke in verse:🔽“There are many disciples of the Sage,🔽who are powerful, know the three knowledges,🔽know the thoughts of others,

analyzed: mthu che ba dag gsum rig dang // sems kyi rnam grangs shes pa dang // zag zad dgra bcom gang yin pa; ;thub pa'i nyan thos mang du mchis //

original: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang 'di snyam du sems te /
analyzed: de nas rgyal po zas gtsang 'di snyam du sems te /
translated: Then King Śuddhodana thought,

analyzed: bdag gi bu 'ba' zhig 'di ltar rdzu 'phrul che zhing mthu che bar ma zad de /
translated: “Not only is my son alone so powerful and mighty,🔽but there are others who have gone forth who are also so powerful and mighty.”

analyzed: srog chags grog sbur rnams kyis lta ga la shes /

analyzed: de nas lha rnams kyi dbang po brgya byin 'di snyam du sems te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ci'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i thugs bskyed pa mdzad snyam pa las de 'di snyam du sems te /

translated: “Viśvakarman,

translated: Because there were two types of beauty,

analyzed: kva'e / sems can kho bo ni kha dog dang ldan la /

analyzed: khyod ni kha dog ngan pa yin no zhes sems can gyis sems can la khyad du gsod par byed do //

analyzed: de nub pa na myu gu'i tshal kha dog phun sum tshogs pa / dri phun sum tshogs pa /
